msContents.summary: This official correspondence records the following events (in reverse chronological order, as was usual): a. A former gymnasiarch in the Arsinoite nome and a group, of unknown size, of diakritai ektheseon of the division of Themistes of this nome submitted a petition (lines 15 ff.) to the strategos of the division of Themistes and Polemon, Aelius Numisianus, probably with regard to the activities of the sitologoi of the Themistes. The date is lost; b. On August 14, 140 A.D. (Mesore 21, third year of Antoninus Pius), Aelius Numisianus forwarded a copy of the petition to Apol(l)inarios, strategos of the meris of Herakleides of the Arsinoite nome, apparently requesting that he look into the matter (lines 8-14); c. Promptly, on the following day (Aug. 15), Apollinarios sent copies of the petition and covering letter to his royal scribe, Sarapion, instructing him to deal with the problem (lines 2-7).

condition.ab: The top and two margins are extant, with a lacuna between fragments a. and b. varying from Ø 11 to Ø 19 letters. The bottom is lost, with the total number of lines unknown; lines 17-22 are particularly fragmentary, while some ink has been rubbed away in lines 14-22.

handDesc.p: Written in an official hand. Variation occurs in the sizes of letters as well as in the formation of particular letters and the spacing of words.

div.ab: "Copy of official communication:;Apollinarios, strategos [of the Arsinoite (nome)], division of Herakleides, to Sarapion, royal scribe, his dearest friend, [many] greetings.; a. [I have sent] you, my dearest friend, the copy of the [petition] sent to me by Aelius Numisianus, strategos of the merides of Themistes and Polemon, concerning . . . sitologoi of the division of Themistes, in order that you may know and fulfill your own part. [I pray] for your health, my dearest friend. The third year of Antoninus Caesar the lord, Mesore 22.; b. Aelius Numisianus, [strategos] of the Arsinoite (nome), divisions of Themistes and Polemon, to Apollinarios, strategos [of the Arsinoite (nome)], meris [of Herakleides], his dearest friend, greeting.; I have sent you, my dearest friend, the copy of a petition submitted [to me by] Kastor (?) son of Marion, former gymnasiarch, and Didymos son of Herakleides, [and] his [associate] diakritai echtheseon of the Themistes, concerning . . ., in order that you may know and with respect to the . . . do (?) . . .; [I pray] for your health, [my dearest friend].; [Through . . .], scribe. The third [year] of Antoninus Caesar the lord, Mesore 21.; c. [To Aelius Numisianus, strategos] of the Arsinoite (nome), divisions of Themistes [and Polemon], from [Kastor (?), son of Marion, former] gymnasiarch, [and Didymos, son of] Herakleides and his associate diakritai [echtheseon of the Themistes] . . . us . . ."
